intro: Crotalaria mesopontica subsp. mesopontica, commonly known as the Mesopotamian cowpea, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring erect, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow flowers with distinctive spurred petals, which are characteristic of the Crotalaria genus. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly pubescent surface. This species is known for its ability to thrive in dry, well-drained soils and is sometimes cultivated as a forage crop.
